Anagram Checker

By Mariah Dunn For Duolingo

View on GitHub Download .zip Download .tar.gz
This is an anagram checker. It can handle numbers and letters. There is also a check box to turn on and off whether or not capital letters should be counted in the anagram. Spaces are counted as letters. Empty strings are not counted as anagrams.

Second String:
Should Capitals count?
Handle Yen\Won issue?*
*There is a checkbox to handle the Yen issue in Japanese fonts. You may have noticed that I put different fonts in the boxes. This was to demonstarte this issue. In many Japanese and Korean Fonts (such as Yu Gothic or Malgun Gothic) the back slash character (U+005c) is hard coded to be a Yen or Won symbol respectively. The scenario handles the case for Yu Gothic. To test this scenario, type a backslash into each box, notice that a yen symbol is in the first box and a backslash is in the second box. Click the anagram button and notice that the status box briefly explains this issue.


Anagram Checker is maintained by mdunn120. This page was generated by GitHub Pages using the Cayman theme by Jason Long.
